sourcesContent:
import React from 'react';
import { Box, Text } from '@chakra-ui/react';

import Header from '../Components/Header';

const Teaching = props => {
  return (
    <Box {...props}>
      <Header
        title="Teaching and Course Development"
        description="Leadership"
      />
      <iframe
        src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/album/1DFixLWuPkv3KT3TnV35m3"
        width="300"
        height="380"
        frameborder="0"
        allowtransparency="true"
        allow="encrypted-media"
      ></iframe>
      <Text marginLeft="20" mt="10" maxW="80%" fontSize="xl" fontWeight={300}>
        Currently, I'm one of the head Teaching Assistant for CSE 14x, the
        introductory computer science series at the University of Washington.
        I've worked within the Allen School as a TA for a year now and it has
        been one of the most enjoyable yet challenging experiences in college.
        Coming into college as a freshman, I had little to no experience with
        Computer Science or programming. CSE14x was my first real structured
        introduction to this new paradigm of program. As I progressed through
        the series, not only did I get a much better appreciation for computer
        science concepts, but it quickly turned into one of my favorite courses.
        As I finished the series, I applied to be a teaching assistant, and got
        the job! Giving back to this intro community is something that I'm
        extremely passionate about. My goal is to try and promote equitable and
        accessable education to all (900 or so) students taking this course. As
        a head TA now, I focus on settup up course infrastructure and developing
        assessments aside from my regular resonsabilities of teaching a quiz
        section and grading exams/homework.
      </Text>
    </Box>
  );
};

export default Teaching;
